IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO INSPIRE YOUTH WITH SPECIAL NEEDS AND TO PROVIDE PRACTICAL TOOLS THAT SUPPORT SUCCESS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: RAMAPO FOR CHILDREN INSPIRES YOUTH WITH SPECIAL NEEDS TO EXPERIENCE SUCCESS, DEVELOP HEALTHY RELATIONSHIPS AND LEARN NECESSARY LIFE SKILLS. ALSO, PROVIDING PRACTICAL TOOLS FOR MANAGING DIFFICULT BEHAVIORS AND FOSTERING ENVIRONMENTS THAT SUPPORT SUCCESS AND PROVIDING SHORT-TERM, ADVENTURE BASED EXPERIENCES FOR YOUNG PEOPLE AND EDUCATORS THAT GIVE PARTICIPANTS STRATEGIES FOR SUCCESSFUL COMMUNICATION, TEAMWORK AND LEADERSHIP.
IRS990.Desc: TRAINING:EMPOWERS TEACHERS, PARENTS, AND OTHER YOUTH-SERVICE PROFESSIONALS WITH THE PRACTICAL TOOLS THEY NEED TO FOSTER POSITIVE BEHAVIORS AND PROMOTE SUCCESS. 2,355 WORKSHOPS AND COACHING SESSIONS WERE DELIVERED IN 2022.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: SUMMER CAMP:A RESIDENTIAL SUMMER CAMP THAT SERVES CHILDREN AGES 6 TO 16 WHO ARE AFFECTED BY SOCIAL, EMOTIONAL, OR LEARNING CHALLENGES, INCLUDING CHILDREN AFFECTED BY AUTISM SPECTRUM DISORDERS. MORE THAN 321 CAMPERS EXPERIENCED THIS PROGRAM IN 2022.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: STAFF ASSISTANT EXPERIENCE:A RESIDENTIAL TRANSITION TO INDEPENDENCE PROGRAM FOR YOURG ADULTS AGES 18 TO 25 WITH SOCIAL, EMOTIONAL, OR LEARNING CHALLENGES. 48 ATTENDEES EXPERIENCED THIS PROGRAM IN 2022.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: RETREATS:RAMAPO FOR CHILDREN OFFERS YEAR-ROUND, ADVENTURE-BASED RETREATS TO A RANGE OF SCHOOL AND COMMUNITY GROUPS IN A PEACEFUL ENVIRONMENT FREE FROM EXCESS NOISE AND DISTRACTIONS. 6,320 ATTENDEES EXPERIENCED THIS PROGRAM IN 2022.ON OUR 250-ACRE RHINEBECK, NEW YORK CAMPUS, OUR HIGHLY TRAINED RETREATS TEAM WILL WORK WITH YOU TO CREATE A CUSTOMIZED EXPERIENCE THAT UTILIZES THE RAMAPO APPROACH TO HELP GROUPS REACH THEIR GOALS AND FORM STRONGER BONDS THROUGH INTERACTIVE, ADVENTURE-BASED ACTIVITIES IN A HEALTHY, SAFE AND SUPPORTIVE ENVIRONMENT. RAMAPO FOR CHILDREN'S RETREATS ARE DESIGNED TO PROMOTE CLEAR COMMUNICATION, TOLERANCE AND TRUST, AND ALLOW AMPLE TIME FOR REFLECTION AND FEEDBACK AMONG ALL GROUP MEMBERS.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART III, LINE 12, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: RENTAL INCOME - 2017 AMOUNT: $ 25,200. 2018 AMOUNT: $ 25,800. 2019 AMOUNT: $ 0. 2020 AMOUNT: $ 5,000.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION RECOGNIZES THE EFFECT OF INCOME TAX POSITIONS ONLY IF THOSE POSITIONS ARE MORE LIKELY THAN NOT TO BE SUSTAINED. MANAGEMENT HAS DETERMINED THAT THE ORGANIZATION HAD NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT WOULD REQUIRE FINANCIAL STATEMENT RECOGNITION OR DISCLOSURE. THE ORGANIZATION IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO EXAMINATIONS BY APPLICABLE TAXING JURISDICTIONS FOR YEARS PRIOR TO OCTOBER 31, 2019.

GAIN ON DISPOSAL OF ASSET 652. REVENUE ATTRIBUTED TO CONSOLIDATED RELATED ENTITIES 1,333,827. SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSES REPORTED ON PART VIII, LINE 8B 91,746. RENTAL EXPENSE REPORTED ON PART VIII, LINE 6B 263,233.
EXPENSES ATTRIBUTED TO CONSOLIDATED RELATED ENTITIES 1,291,359. SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSES REPORTED ON PART VIII, LINE 8B 91,746. RENTAL EXPENSE REPORTED ON PART VIII, LINE 6B 263,233.

THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS IN A NONDISCRIMINATORY AND OBJECTIVE MANNER TO FAMILIES WHO DEMONSTRATE FINANCIAL NEED. FAMILIES ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT DOCUMENTATION THAT IS REVIEWED BY THE ORGANIZATION. ONCE THE BOARD APPROVES THE INDIVIDUAL MEETS THE NEEDS, SCHOLARSHIPS WERE DEDUCTED DIRECTLY FROM THE CAMP FEES.
THE ORGANIZATION PAID A BOARD-APPROVED PERFORMANCE BASED BONUS IN 2021.
THE ORGANIZATION IS REPORTING THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTORS IN COLUMN (B).

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MICHAEL ROSENBAUM AND NINA FRIEDMAN HAVE A FAMILY RELATIONSHIP. KIRSTEN AXELSEN CARMEL AND ANN E. CARMEL HAVE A FAMILY RELATIONSHIP.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS PREPARED BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM BASED ON INFORMATION PROVIDED BY THE ORANIZATION AND IN CONSULTATION WITH THE ORGANIZATION'S STAFF. THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER FOR APPROVAL. IF CHANGES ARE REQUIRED, THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER WILL THEN FORWARD THESE CHANGES TO THE ACCOUNTING FIRM AND A FINAL VERSION WILL BE DISTRIBUTED TO BOARD MEMBERS AT THE NEXT MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HAS A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY APPLICABLE TO DIRECTORS AND OFFICERS, OR ANY OTHER INDIVIDUAL IN A POSITION TO EXERCISE SUBSTANTIAL INFLUENCE OVER THE AFFAIRS OF THE CORPORATION WHO HAS A DIRECT OR INDIRECT FINANCIAL INTEREST. IN CONNECTION WITH ANY ACTUAL OR POSSIBLE CONFLICTS OF INTEREST, AN INTERESTED PERSON MUST DISCLOSE THE EXISTENCE OF HIS OR HER FINANCIAL INTEREST AND MUST BE GIVEN THE OPPORTUNITY TO DISCLOSE ANY MATERIAL FACTS TO THE DIRECTORS AND MEMBERS OF COMMITTEES WITH BOARD-DELEGATED POWERS CONSIDERING THE PROPOSED TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT. AFTER DISCLOSURE OF THE FINANCIAL INTEREST AND ALL MATERIAL FACTS, AND AFTER ANY DISCUSSION WITH THE INTERESTED PERSON, HE/SHE SHALL LEAVE THE BOARD OR COMMITTEE MEETING WHILE THE DETERMINATION OF A CONFLICT OF INTEREST IS DISCUSSED AND VOTED UPON. THE REMAINING BOARD OR COMMITTEE MEMBERS SHALL DECIDE IF A CONFLICT OF INTEREST EXISTS. EACH DIRECTOR, OFFICER AND MEMBER OF A COMMITTEE WITH BOARD-DELEGATED POWERS MUST COMPLETE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE STATEMENT ON AN ANNUAL BASIS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COMPENSATION OF THE CEO AND OTHER OFFICERS ARE DETERMINED USING COMPARABLE DATA OF COMPENSATION PAID AT SIMILAR ORGANIZATIONS, SUCH AS FORMS 990 OF OTHER ORGANIZATIONS. THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE DETERMINES AND APPROVES THE APPROPRIATE COMPENSATION LEVELS, WHICH ARE SUBJECT TO THE BOARD'S APPROVAL. THE PROCESS WAS LAST CONDUCTED IN 2022 WAS DOCUMENTED IN THE MINUTES OF THE COMMITTEE MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, FORM 990 AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

THE ORGANIZATION HAS AN COMMITTEE THAT IS RESPONSIBLE FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT OF THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND THE SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT. THE PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.

AT THE TIME OF THE ORIGINAL FILING, THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS WERE NOT READY. DUE TO THE ISSUANCE OF THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, THE RETURN HAS BEEN AMENDED, AND THE FOLLOWING SECTIONS CHANGED: 1. PAGE 1, BOX G: GROSS RECEIPTS WAS UPDATED TO REFLECT THE UPDATED REVENUE REPORTED IN PART VIII. 2. PART I, LINES 8-22 (CURRENT YEAR): THESE AMOUNTS WERE UPDATED TO REFLECT THE CHANGES REPORTED IN THEIR RESPECTIVE PARTS OF THE RETURN. 3. PART III, LINE 4A: THE TOTAL PROGRAM EXPENSES WERE UPDATED TO AGREE TO PART VIII AND PART IX. 4. PART IV, LINE 11F AND 12B: CHECKED YES BASED ON THE ISSUANCE OF THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. 5. PART VIII: STATEMENT OF REVENUE WAS UPDATED TO AGREE TO THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. 6. PART IX, STATEMENT OF FUNCTIONAL EXPENSES: WAS UPDATED TO AGREE WITH THE REVISED FUNCTIONAL ALLOCATION INCLUDED IN THE ISSUED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. 7. PART X: THE BALANCE SHEET WAS UPDATED TO AGREE TO THE ISSUED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. 8. PART XI: THE RECONCILIATION OF NET ASSETS WAS REVISED TO AGREE TO THE UPDATED STATEMENT OF REVENUE AND STATEMENT OF FUNCTIONAL EXPENSES. A PRIOR PERIOD ADJUSTMENT WAS ADDED TO ADJUST FOR THE CHANGE IN OPENING NET ASSETS WHICH WAS RESTATED AS PART OF THE ISSUED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. 9. PART XII, LINE 2B: THIS QUESTION WAS UPDATED TO REFLECT THAT AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS WERE PREPARED. 10. SCHEDULE A, PART III WAS UPDATE TO REFLECT THE CHANGES TO PART VIII DUE TO THE ISSUANCE OF THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS 11. THE FOLLOWING SECTIONS IN SCHEDULE D WERE UPDATED TO AGREE WITH THE CHANGES FROM THE ISSUED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS: PART V, VI, PART IX, PART X, PART XI, PART XII AND PART XIII.
